smell_analysis.justification: No empty diagrams were found in the provided file.
All use cases in the diagram on page 2 are associated with at least one actor, either directly or through generalization/include relationships.
No use cases with synonymous names associated with the same actor were found.
On page 14, in the 'Laudade register (transformed)' diagram, the table 'laud' lists the column 'FK ruumi_kood' twice.
No redundant data copies without foreign keys were identified. Common columns like 'reg_aeg' are standard audit fields, not denormalized data.
Use case naming is consistent; all use cases on page 2 start with an imperative verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri').
All states in the state diagram on page 11 are reachable from the start node.
All actions in the activity diagrams on pages 3 and 4 are reachable.
On page 10, the association between the class 'Laud' and the class 'laua_kategooria_omamine' lacks multiplicity indicators (e.g., 1, 0..*) at both ends.
The use case diagram on page 2 contains 11 central elements (use cases), which exceeds the threshold of fewer than 10.
No single class or table was found to have 6 or more visual connection lines on a single diagram page.
The layout of the diagrams is relatively compact, and no related elements were found with excessive distance between them.
All use cases and activity actions appear to start with an active verb.
No class, table, attribute, or use case names were found to be 3 characters or less (e.g., 'Riik', 'Isik', 'Laud' are 4 characters).
On page 10, the class named 'laua_kategooria_omamine' starts with a lowercase letter, violating the naming convention.
All inspected attribute and column names start with a lowercase letter.
All table names appear to be singular (e.g., 'laud', 'Isik', 'Tootaja').
No prohibited prefixes (Hungarian notation) were found. Prefixes like 'FK_', 'PK_', and 'pfK' found in the transformed diagrams are explicitly allowed.
